medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 nights ago while out of state on a business trip. Initially attributed to reflux after having a glass of red wine, but pain persisted. Continued to experience abdominal pain throughout the next day, which wandered throughout the abdomen. Experienced sharp pains in the right upper quadrant (RUQ) and flank pain reminiscent of previous kidney stone episodes. Pain was the only symptom reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, nephrolithiasis; previous lithotripsy for kidney stones.
